subject: p15370732
Findings: As compared to the previous radiograph, the patient has received a nasogastric tube. The course of the tube through the esophagus is unremarkable. The tip of the tube appears to project over the very proximal parts of the stomach, the tube should be advanced by approximately 5 cm. Otherwise, there is no relevant change. No complications such as pneumothorax.
